sentences.english: Blushing, she turns her head without a qualm.
A few sheepishly say they are just exploring their options.
sentences.chinese: 少數人會羞答答的說他們正在斟酌他們的選擇。

sentences.english: One says sort of news because of the timid way this development has been presented.
sentences.chinese: 說是幾分新意，是因爲這個發展態勢是羞答答的。

sentences.english: Would you please tell the name of that girl who looks as shy as Daphne?
sentences.chinese: 你能告訴我那位羞答答的女孩叫什麼名字嗎？

sentences.english: She glanced shyly at Smith out of the corners of her eyes.
sentences.chinese: 她羞答答地瞟了史密斯一眼。

sentences.english: Then, as though her heart had said, 'Is coyness longer necessary?
sentences.chinese: 後來，她心裏似乎在說，“還有必要再羞答答的嗎？

sentences.english: The fair and gentle Eulalie has become my blushing bride.
sentences.chinese: 美麗溫柔的尤拉麗亞成了我羞答答的新娘。

sentences.english: She containing sheepishly, in cells with the outside world.
sentences.chinese: 她含羞答答，在探視着外面的世界。

sentences.english: There is a natural coyness about her behavior.
sentences.chinese: 她的舉止令人有種自然的羞答答的感覺。

definition: affecting shyness or embarrassment/coy/mincing (walk, manner of speech)/mannered
affecting shyness or embarrassment/coy/mincing (walk, manner of speech)/mannered
to blush/to redden (with shame, indignation etc)
in a fine voice (idiom); softly spoken
